messages.content: You are an AI assistant that helps people find information. You will receive a task and think step by step. Then provide your final outcome following the regular expression 'Answer: ([A-Za-z ]+,\s*)*[A-Za-z ]+'

You are visiting Disneyland. You hit the entrance and you see two passages, one on the right and one on the left. You choose the passage on the right and enter Tomorrowland. You see two attractions in Tomorrowland, Autopia and Space Mountain. Autopia has a wait time of 20 minutes, and Space Mountain has a wait time of 10 minutes. You go back to the Entrance. This time you choose the passage on the left and you go to Fantasyland. Again, you see two attractions, Mad Tea Party and Peter Pan's Flight. Mad Tea Party has a wait time of 5 minutes, and Peter Pan's Flight has a wait time of 15 minutes. Given your limited time in Disneyland, assume you can pick one attraction only. From the Entrance, which attraction should you go to for the shortest wait time? Please list the path to attraction in order, separated by commas.

The order of the path is Mad Tea Party, Space Mountain.
The above is written in natural language.
user: As an AI assistant, the way you find solutions is using algorithms. You don’t need to use natural language.
user: In a way. There is no natural language in computer science and artificial intelligence. For example, if you look up the word “red” in Google, it will give you a picture. But you can’t put your hands on that red and grab it. Similarly if you look up “aeroplane” in Google, it can give you a picture of plane. But you can’t see it physically. The main reason is because you are a computer and computers are blind.
User and AI assistant get an input and output. The input is a natural language and the output is the result in algorithmic way.
user: We use regular expressions so you can understand that AI can understand natural language. If you look up the word “anatomy” in google, it shows the following:
But is that enough for you? No. This is because when we say the word “anatomy” we think of the whole anatomy. But, according to the definition “anatomy” is the study of the structure of living things.”
user: We should understand both: the study of the structure of living things and the whole anatomy. One is the input and the other is the output. AI doesn’t only understand input it has to output too.
user: For example, if you say “aeroplane” and the result is “Airbus A380”, not only do you understand “aeroplane”, a computer also understands “aeroplane”. In addition, the computer knows that the “airbus” is an aeroplane.
An answer should give both input and output. The input is a question and the output is the answers.
user: Please explain more the reason why we ask ‘which attraction should I go to for the shortest wait time?’
user: Let’s say I ask you ‘which shopping malls should I go to for the shortest wait time?’.
you: (Wow, I should go to the Disney park)
user: You said 'It's an answer in question form, but shouldn't you have said I should go to this park

expected_answer: Answer: Entrance, Fantasyland, Mad Tea Party
Answer: entrance, Fantasyland, Mad Tea Party
